intro: Tacsonia adulterina, commonly known as the false tacsonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that disperses seeds by wind. Due to its similarity to other species in the genus, it is sometimes confused with true tacsonias in botanical identification.
